intro: Cargillia pentamera, commonly known as the five-lobed lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, flat thallus with a yellowish to orange-brown coloration. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic alga and a fungal partner, which allows it to thrive in various habitats. It is typically found on bark, rocks, and soil surfaces in temperate regions. Cargillia pentamera is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
